data._description: Array of values (inc array of arrays) for time series

units._description: Core unit (SI if possible) of values stored in 'data'

conversion._description: Multiplicative value required to convert element in 'data' to unit described in 'units'

resolution._description: Minimum meaningful difference between possible values in 'data'. E.g., magnitude of least significant bit before AD conversion. Value in units of 'units'

num_samples._description: Number of samples stored in the time series. This can be less than the length of 'data'

interval._description: Number of entries in 'data' stored between each timestamp. Presently this must be '1' (ie, there's a timestamp for each data point)

starting_time._description: Starting time of data plus sampling rate

rate._description: Sampling rate (Hz) of data stored in time series

units._description: Sampling or presentation rate (Hz) of data stored in time series

sync._description: Storage for time (arbitrary format) coming from hardware device, before it is converted to common time base for 'timestamps' or 'starting_time'

neurodata_type._description: Label to identify this group as a time series

missing_fields._description: List of required fields in time series that are missing. Only present if fields are missing

timestamps_link._description: List of all time series (paths) that have HDF5 links to the 'timestamps' field

data_link._description: List of all time series (paths) that have HDF5 links to the 'data' field

data_softlink._description: List of all time series (paths) that have soft HDF5 links to the 'data' field

ancestry._description: List of required fields in time series that are missing. Only present if fields are missing

description._description: Description of time series, preferably in human-readable str

comments._description: Additional comments about time series, preferably in human-readable str

help._description: Description of the time series, populated by the _description field

source._description: Name (path) of the time series or module that serves as a source for the data stored here.  This can also be the name of a device

data._description: Array of annotation strings (e.g., about an experimental event)

IntervalSeries._description: Stores the start and stop times for events

data._description: Interval start and stop times -- positive value (+1) means interval start, negative (-1) is end)

PatchClampSeries._description: Superclass definition for patch-clamp data (this class should not be instantiated directly)

electrode_name._description: Name of folder in /general/intracellular_ephys containing electrode description

VoltageClampSeries._description: Current recorded from cell during voltage-clamp recording

CurrentClampSeries._description: Voltage recorded from cell during current-clamp recording

VoltageClampStimulusSeries._description: Stimulus voltage applied during voltage clamp recording

CurrentClampStimulusSeries._description: Stimulus current applied during current clamp recording

AbstractFeatureSeries._description: Features of an applied stimulus. This is useful when storing the raw stimulus is impractical

ElectricalSeries._description: Stores acquired voltage data from extracellular recordings

electrode_idx._description: Indices to electrodes described in experiment's electrode map array (under general/extracellular_ephys

SpikeEventSeries._description: Snapshots of spike events from data. Source of data needs to be specified. 'data' array structure: [event_num][channel_num][sample_num]

source._description: Source of events (eg, timeseries, hardware) and description of event definition

SpatialSeries._description: Stores points in space over time. The data[] array structure is [num samples][num spatial dimenstions]

reference_frame._description: Description of what the spatial coordinates refer to. Eg, relative position as determined by tracking video, GPS coordinates, etc

OpticalSeries._description: Time-series image stack for optical recording or stimulus

field_of_view._description: Width, height and dept of image, or imaged area (in meters)

distance._description: Distance of camera/monitor from target/eye, if relevant

orientation._description: Description of image relative to some reference frame (eg, which way is up?). Must also specify frame of reference

ImageSeries._description: Storage object for time-series 2-D image data

format._description: Format if image. If this is 'external' then field 'external_file' contains path or URL for that file. For tiff, png, jpg, etc, the binary representation of the image is stored in data[]. For 'raw', only a single channel (eg, red) is stored

external_file._description: Path or URL to external file if format='external'

bits_per_pixel._description: Number of bits per image pixel

dimension._description: An array storing the number of pixels on x, y and z axes

ImageIndexSeries._description: An image sequence that is generated from an existing image stack. Frames can be presented in an arbitrary order. The data[] field stores frame number in reference stack

ImageMaskSeries._description: An alpha mask that is applied to a presented visual stimulus. The data array contains an array of mask values that are applied to the displayed image. Mask values are stored as RGBA. Mask can vary with time.  The timestamps array indicates the starting time of a mask, and that mask pattern continues until it's explicitly changed

masked_image._description: Path to ImageSeries that mask applies to

field_of_view._description: Width, height and dept of image, or imaged area (in meters)

pmt_gain._description: generic field for a/d unit per photon

imaging_plane._description: Name of entry in general/optophysiology describing details about this imaging plane

WidefieldSeries._description: Image stack recorded from wide-field imaging

site._description: Pointer to description of stimulation site

RoiResponseSeries._description: ROI responses over an imaging plane. Each row in data[] should correspond to the signal from one ROI

segmentation_source._description: Path to segmentation module defining ROIs

roi_names._description: Array of ROI names, one for each row in data[]. Names must be the same as used in the segmentation module
